events.originalText: A gas leak caused an explosion in the East Harlem neighborhood of New York City, destroying two apartment buildings and causing eight deaths.
events.subtitle: 2014 East Harlem gas explosion
events.headline: Gas leak explosion in East Harlem neighborhood of New York City kills eight

events.originalText: U.S. Army soldiers gang-raped a 14-year-old Iraqi girl and murdered her along with her family members.
events.subtitle: Mahmudiyah rape and killings
events.headline: U.S. Army soldiers gang-rape and murder 14-year-old Iraqi girl and family

events.originalText: Tim Berners-Lee submitted a memorandum at CERN with details of an information-management system, the first proposal for what would become the World Wide Web.
events.subtitle: Tim Berners-Lee
events.headline: Tim Berners-Lee submits memorandum at CERN, laying groundwork for World Wide Web

events.originalText: The Turkish Armed Forces executed a "coup by memorandum", forcing the resignation of Prime Minister Süleyman Demirel.
events.subtitle: Turkish Armed Forces
events.headline: Turkish Armed Forces execute coup by memorandum, Prime Minister Süleyman Demirel resigns

events.originalText: British diplomat Lord Ismay (pictured) was appointed the first secretary general of NATO.
events.subtitle: Hastings Ismay, 1st Baron Ismay
events.headline: Lord Ismay appointed first secretary general of NATO

events.originalText: Cold War: U.S. president Harry S. Truman proclaimed the Truman Doctrine to help stem the spread of communism.
events.subtitle: Cold War
events.headline: Truman Doctrine proclaimed by U.S. president to combat communism

events.originalText: The Moscow Peace Treaty was signed, ending the Winter War between Finland and the Soviet Union.
events.subtitle: Moscow Peace Treaty
events.headline: Moscow Peace Treaty signed, ending Winter War between Finland and Soviet Union

events.originalText: Supported by the Estonian army, Konstantin Päts staged a coup d'état, beginning the Era of Silence.
events.subtitle: Konstantin Päts
events.headline: Konstantin Päts stages coup d'état with Estonian army support, Era of Silence begins

events.originalText: U.S. president Franklin D. Roosevelt delivered the first of his fireside chats, addressing the nation directly via radio.
events.subtitle: Franklin D. Roosevelt
events.headline: Franklin D. Roosevelt delivers first fireside chat via radio

events.originalText: Mahatma Gandhi (pictured with Sarojini Naidu) began the Salt March, a 24-day nonviolent walk to defy the British salt tax in colonial India.
events.subtitle: Mahatma Gandhi
events.headline: Mahatma Gandhi starts Salt March to protest British salt tax in colonial India

events.originalText: At a ceremony at Kurrajong Hill, Lady Denman, wife of Governor-General Lord Denman, announced that Canberra would be the name of the future capital of Australia.
events.subtitle: Capital Hill, Australian Capital Territory
events.headline: Canberra announced as future capital of Australia at Kurrajong Hill ceremony

events.originalText: Andrew Watson captained the Scotland national football team against England, becoming the world's first black international footballer.
events.subtitle: Andrew Watson (footballer, born 1856)
events.headline: Andrew Watson captains Scotland national football team, first black international footballer

events.originalText: Ignatius of Loyola and Francis Xavier, founders of the Jesuits, were canonized by Pope Gregory XV.
events.subtitle: Ignatius of Loyola
events.headline: Ignatius of Loyola and Francis Xavier canonized by Pope Gregory XV
